00023 typedef int (*verify_cb)(int,X509_STORE_CTX*); /* error callback */

00063         // generic MatchType { U_FNMATCH = 0, U_DOSMATCH = 1, U_DOSMATCH_WITH_OR = 2 };

00065         static bool match(const UString& s, const UString& mask)
00066                 {
00067                 U_TRACE(0, "UServices::match(%.*S,%.*S)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(s), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(mask))
00068 
00069                 bool result = u_pfn_match(U_STRING_TO_PARAM(s), U_STRING_TO_PARAM(mask), u_pfn_flags);
00070 
00071                 U_RETURN(result);
00072                 }
00073 
00074         static bool match(const UStringRep* r, const UString& mask)
00075                 {
00076                 U_TRACE(0, "UServices::match(%p,%.*S)", r, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(mask))
00077 
00078                 bool result = u_pfn_match(U_STRING_TO_PARAM(*r), U_STRING_TO_PARAM(mask), u_pfn_flags);
00079 
00080                 U_RETURN(result);
00081                 }

00166 #ifdef HAVE_SSL
00167         /* setup OPENSSL standard certificate directory. The X509_STORE holds the tables etc for verification stuff.
00168         A X509_STORE_CTX is used while validating a single certificate. The X509_STORE has X509_LOOKUPs for looking
00169         up certs. The X509_STORE then calls a function to actually verify the certificate chain
00170         */
00171 
00172         static UString* CApath;
00173         static X509_STORE* store;
00174 
00175         static void setCApath(const char* _CApath);
00176 
00177         /* When something goes wrong, this is why */
00178 
00179         static int verify_error;
00180         static int verify_depth;            /* how far to go looking up certs */
00181         static X509* verify_current_cert;   /* current certificate */
00182 
00183         static const char* verify_status(long result);
00184 
00185         static const char* verify_status() { return verify_status(verify_error); }
00186 
00187         static void setVerifyCallback(verify_cb func)
00188                 {
00189                 U_TRACE(0, "UServices::setVerifyCallback(%p)", func)
00190 
00191                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(func)
00192                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(store)
00193 
00194                 X509_STORE_set_verify_cb_func(store, func);
00195                 }
00196 
00197         static UString getFileName(long hash, bool crl = false)
00198                 {
00199                 U_TRACE(0, "UServices::getFileName(%08x,%b)", hash, crl)
00200 
00201                 if (CApath)
00202                         {
00203                         UString buffer(U_CAPACITY);
00204 
00205                         buffer.snprintf("%.*s/%08x.%s", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(*CApath), hash, (crl ? "r0" : "0"));
00206 
00207                         U_RETURN_STRING(buffer);
00208                         }
00209 
00210                 U_RETURN_STRING(UString::getStringNull());
00211                 }
00212 
00213         static void getOpenSSLError(UString& buffer)
00214                 {
00215                 U_TRACE(0, "UServices::getOpenSSLError(%p)", &buffer)
00216 
00217                 uint32_t size;
00218 
00219                 (void) getOpenSSLError(buffer.data(), buffer.capacity(), &size);
00220 
00221                 buffer.size_adjust(size);
00222                 }
